page.title: 02Kettlesing - A Dales Village
page.content: Kettlesing is a scattered village in the civil parish of Felliscliffe, covering 2 sq.km. to the SE of the block. It is a fine example of a Yorkshire Dales village, with scatter- ed hamlets such as Kettlesing Bottom, Kettlesing Head, Tang and Longscales, stretching along the sides of the Tang Beck and in the sheltered valley bottom. The majority of the houses are modernised farmhouses or agricultural buildings, many over a century old, though there are scattered recently- built bungalows. The village has two inns, a licens- ed restaurant, a primary school, an Anglican Church and Methodist Church, and a village hall. The local shop/ Post Office closed in early 1985.
